Throttle a flow

Throttling a flow can allow us to control the rate at which we send requests to a target. This is very important as it allows us to meet the processing rate of the target system and essentially prevent our ESB from hammering a system with requests. The throttle limit can be set in a flow and as such will allow us to dictate a different speed for different targets.

Here is an example of our Async Ping flow being throttled.
